result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Blaine Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Unpaid court obligations.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

11:50  Atty Sean Froelich is present for the State of WI and Adam Blaine Anderson is present with attorney Heremiah Harrelson.  Froelich requests 1 yr probation and conditional jail time.  Harrelson requests a fine. Court orders S/W 1 yr probation. Cond: Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  14 days conditional jail time with huber.  Jail is stayed until 2-17-17 at 5:00 PM  Release date is 3-3-17. Appeal rights are given.

from the Jury to the Judge and Judge's responses.
Sentencing hearing on January 17, 2017 at 11:45 am.

09:15  18 Jurors are seated.Defendant Adam Blaine Anderson in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin  .9:20  Judge Boles calls the case and reads the charges.  Judge Boles does general voir dire of the pane.  Atty Froelich voir dires the panel.   Atty Harrelson voir dires the panel.  Attorneys make 3 strikes each. 12 jurors selected and sworn. Jury is excused for 20 minutes. Court recesses.   10:54  Court resumes. Attys have reviewed the video and address the Judge about where to start the video. 11:15  Court resumes and the jury, attys, defendant are present. Opening statements are given by Atty Froelich and Atty Harrelson. . Officer Chad Koranda is sw and exam by Atth Froelich. Atty Froelich offers Exh # 1 Video taken by Invest Shepler( 10:34 -   offered and rec. Witness  is Id by Officer Koranda. Atty Harrelson x-exams. Atty Froelich redirects. 12:17 Breack for lunch.  Resume 1:05.
1:11  Court resumes Attorneys and Defendant are present. Atty Harrelson objects to a copy of warrant that Atty Froelich wants to address in his case.  Court will research this and will discuss later.  1:23 Jury returns to the courtroom.  Deputy Brad Vergas is sw and ex by Atty Froelich. Atty Harrelson x-exams.  1:38 Jury excused. Attys and defendant are present. . Discuss Atty Harrelson researching the warrant issue. 1:39  break for 15 minutes to research warrant issue.1:58 Court resumes with the attorneys and defendant presents. Harrelson addresses the court of what he found regarding this issue. Atty Froelich responds to that. Court addresses - he feels it is not physical evidence. Atty Harrelson states his client will not testify on his own behalf. Judge goes over the defendants right to testify with him. Defendant states he is waiving his right to testify on his own behalf.  Judicial notice has been taken of a warrant in another case involving the defendant. . The State rests. The jury leaves the courtroom. 2:16  The defense moves for dismissal of the case. Court denies the motion. 2:21  The jury returns to the courtroom.   Defense rests.    Jury is excused.  2:22 Verdict and instruction conference.  will be held.  No objection to the verdict by either party. Instructions are reviewed and approved. 2:41 Recess   3:02 Court resumes. Attorneys, defendant, and jury are present. Judge reads the jury insturctions to the jury. Atty Froelich gives his closing arguement.  Attorney Harrelson gives his final arguement.  3:37   Atty Froelich gives closing statement. The bailiffs are sworn. Jury is excused to deliberate. 3:46  4:06  The jury sent out a question. The attys and defendant are present in the courtroom. They decide on a response and the Judge sends it back in to them. 4:08    5:47  Jury has another question - Judge discuss with attorneys who are present as well as the defendant, and wites answer. 6:00  Jury has another question. - Attorneys, defendant are present in courtroom. Judge read question and writes the answer to return to them.
7:23  Jury reutrns with a verdict.  Guilty.   Judge polls the verdict.   Court finds the defendant guilty based on the verdict of the jury.

8:34  In the East Courtroom out of the presense of the jury Defendant Adam Blaine Anderson in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge reviews witnesses and precedure regarding the defendant testifying or not.   Motion to file amended criminal complaint by the State. The defense does not object and the Court will amend the charge as the state requested. Discussion regarding the video that State wants to play.
Motion to File amended criminal complaint filed by Atty Froelich

Court, case will remain on for trial. Atty Harrelson: trial has been rescheduled before, addresses concern with voir dire process. Court indicates that attorneys can follow up during voir dire process if necessary. Parties to be here at 8:30 am day of trial. 11:43

Defendant Adam Blaine Anderson in court, in custod  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with Christopher Bub via phone.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Bub enters not guilty plea.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  Thorie:  Requests $500 cash bond.  Bub requests lower cash bond of $100.  Thorie - 15CF128 - outstanding felony warrant in Pierce Co. and Pepin Co. felony warrant as well.  Bub addresses Pepin Co. warrant.  Court orders cash bond of $500.  Defendant has not been a member of the armed services.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 11:30 am.
